column50: {'Id': 1, 'Name': 'Almindelige vilkår'}, {'Id': 2, 'Name': 'Fleksjob'}, {'Id': 3, 'Name': 'Skånejob'}, {'Id': 4, 'Name': 'Egnet til efterlønnere og seniorer'}, {'Id': 5, 'Name': 'Job med løntilskud'}, {'Id': 6, 'Name': 'Rotationsjob'}, {'Id': 7, 'Name': 'Virksomhedspraktik'}
column100:
Requisition ID:   25617   Location(s):   Aarhus N, Region Midtjylland, DK   Work experience:   Management   Type of position:   Full-Time     Vestas Factory   Are you an experienced Construction Manager and are looking for a new and exciting opportunity? Do you have great commercial strategy skills? Are you a team-oriented professional with great stakeholder management skills? Are you someone who is enthusiastic about sustainable energy solutions and is motivated to protect the environment? If so, then Vestas may have the opportunity for you!     EVP NCE - SBU NCE Construction & Operations - Construction Offshore     The goal of Pre-Installation is to support the projects in the region, in a productive execution of the Construction Projects. Pre-Installation supports the construction projects by finishing as much work on the turbine components as possible, before sending them offshore and are responsible for the handling of components from delivery to site up until making them available for Installation at the quay side. Pre-Installation plans and carries out the activities on site and provides for the timely and safe execution of the project to the right level of quality and within Pre-Installation budget.     Responsibilities:     You will be leading the Pre-Installation department and reporting to PA Steering Ground, Director   You will be responsible for budgets and financial performance on individual projects in accordance with turbine fee e.g. ensure delivery within time, budget, and quality in a safe manner   Set up an effective organisation and effective governance of your project portfolio and ensure that projects are compliant with department and company strategy   Develop, scope, and implement department operational tools to ensure operations and alignment across entire project value chain   Initiate and ensure continuous improvements and lessons learned are incorporated during life span of the project   Commercial strategy, develop and maintain material for selection of sub-contractor companies of Heavy Lift and Transport suppliers and negotiation of technical and commercial matters in relation to new crane setups   Participate in selection of new harbour locations and negotiation of commercial matters in relation to new harbour setups.       Qualifications:     Master‘s degree or equivalent 5-10 years' experience within relevant areas (e.g. Engineering, Project Management)   You will have a great understanding of product and value chain   You will have commercial understanding, strong business, and financial insight   Previous risk and people management experience   Complex stakeholder management   Experience working with Quality and HSE policies and processes   Have advanced expertise with MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)   Fluency in English         Competencies:     You should have great leadership skills and be able to apply those in complex circumstances   You can navigate complex situations and environments   You can reflect over and be able to adjust personal behavior as well as approaches according to the situation   You are a good communicator with the ability to target relevant audiences and see the big picture   You are detail and team orientated and motivated by achieving goals   As a person you can motivate your team, make quick decisions, and use your own initiative       What we offer:   We offer an exciting job with great opportunities for professional and personal development in an inspiring environment with the energy industry's global partner on sustainable energy solutions. We value initiative, responsibility, and the right balance between creativity and quality in all solutions. You will become part of a highly professional environment with a good technical commitment.     Additional information   Primary work location: Aarhus, DK     This position requires up to 60 days travel per year.      Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis however, please note we do amend or withdraw our jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Please be advised to apply on or before  25th May 2022.      You can apply online by clicking on the "Send Ansøging" button at the top or bottom of this page.       About Vestas   Vestas is the energy industry’s global partner on sustainable energy solutions. We are specialised in designing, manufacturing, installing, and servicing wind turbines, both onshore and offshore.    Across the globe, we have installed more wind power than anyone else. We consider ourselves pioneers within the industry, as we continuously aim to design new solutions and technologies to create a more sustainable future for all of us. With more than 145 GW of wind power installed worldwide and 40+ years of experience in wind energy, we have an unmatched track record demonstrating our expertise within the field.    With 29,000 employees globally, we are a diverse team united by a common goal: to power the solution – today, tomorrow, and far into the future.    Vestas promotes a diverse workforce which embraces all social identities and is free of any discrimination. We commit to create and sustain an environment that acknowledges and harvests different experiences, skills, and perspectives. We also aim to give everyone equal access to opportunity.    To learn more about our company and life at Vestas, we invite you to visit our website at www.vestas.com and follow us on our social media channels. We also encourage you to join our Talent Universe to receive notifications on new and relevant postings. 
 Denne jobannonce blev oprindeligt opslået på https://www.ofir.dk/
 (Den originale annonce kan ses på: https://www.ofir.dk/showojob?ofirid=25343003)
